   20: 
   21: -module(timer_bif_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   24: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: -export([start_timer_1/1, send_after_1/1, send_after_2/1, send_after_3/1,
   26: 	 cancel_timer_1/1, cancel_timer_sync/1,
   27: 	 start_timer_big/1, send_after_big/1,
   28: 	 start_timer_e/1, send_after_e/1, cancel_timer_e/1,
   29: 	 read_timer_trivial/1, read_timer/1, read_timer_async/1,
   30: 	 cleanup/1, evil_timers/1, registered_process/1, same_time_yielding/1,
   31: 	 same_time_yielding_with_cancel/1, same_time_yielding_with_cancel_other/1,
   32: %	 same_time_yielding_with_cancel_other_accessor/1,
   33: 	 auto_cancel_yielding/1,
   34:          suspended_scheduler_timeout/1,
   35:          multizero_timeout_in_timeout/1,
   36:          huge_timeout/1]).
   37: 
   38: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   39: 
   40: -define(SHORT_TIMEOUT, 5000). %% Bif timers as short as this may be pre-allocated
   41: -define(TIMEOUT_YIELD_LIMIT, 100).
   42: -define(AUTO_CANCEL_YIELD_LIMIT, 100).
   43: 
   44: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   45:     case catch erts_debug:get_internal_state(available_internal_state) of
   46: 	true -> ok;
   47: 	_ -> erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true)
   48:     end,
   49:     Config.
   50: 
   51: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   52:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   53: 
   54: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   55:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
   56:     Config.
   57: 
   58: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   59:     catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false).
   60: 
   61: suite() ->
   62:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   63:      {timetrap, {minutes, 5}}].
   64: 
   65: all() -> 
   66:     [start_timer_1, send_after_1, send_after_2,
   67:      cancel_timer_1, cancel_timer_sync, start_timer_e, send_after_e,
   68:      cancel_timer_e, start_timer_big, send_after_big,
   69:      read_timer_trivial, read_timer, read_timer_async,
   70:      cleanup, evil_timers, registered_process,
   71:      same_time_yielding, same_time_yielding_with_cancel,
   72:      same_time_yielding_with_cancel_other,
   73: %     same_time_yielding_with_cancel_other_accessor,
   74:      auto_cancel_yielding,
   75:      suspended_scheduler_timeout,
   76:      multizero_timeout_in_timeout,
   77:      huge_timeout].
   78: 
   79: 
   80: %% Basic start_timer/3 functionality
   81: start_timer_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   82:     Ref1 = erlang:start_timer(1000, self(), plopp),
   83:     ok   = get(1400, {timeout, Ref1, plopp}),
   84: 
   85:     false = erlang:read_timer(Ref1),
   86:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(Ref1),
   87:     false = erlang:read_timer(Ref1),
   88: 
   89:     Ref2  = erlang:start_timer(1000, self(), plapp),
   90:     Left2 = erlang:cancel_timer(Ref2),
   91:     UpperLimit = 1000,
   92:     true = (Left2 > 600) and (Left2 =< UpperLimit),
   93:     empty = get_msg(),
   94:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(Ref2),
   95: 
   96:     Ref3 = erlang:start_timer(1000, self(), plopp),
   97:     no_message = get(600, {timeout, Ref3, plopp}),
   98:     ok.
   99: 
  100: %% Basic send_after/3 functionality
  101: send_after_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  102:     Ref3 = erlang:send_after(1000, self(), plipp),
  103:     ok = get(1500, plipp),
  104:     false = erlang:read_timer(Ref3),
  105:     ok.
  106: 
  107: %% Big timeouts for start_timer/3
  108: start_timer_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  109:     Big = 1 bsl 31,
  110:     R = erlang:start_timer(Big, self(), hej),
  111:     timer:sleep(200),
  112:     Left = erlang:cancel_timer(R),
  113:     case Big - Left of
  114:         Diff when Diff >= 200, Diff < 10000 ->
  115:             ok;
  116:         _Diff ->
  117:             ct:fail({big, Big, Left})
  118:     end,
  119:     ok.
  120: 
  121: %% Big timeouts for send_after/3
  122: send_after_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  123:     Big = 1 bsl 31,
  124:     R = erlang:send_after(Big, self(), hej),
  125:     timer:sleep(200),
  126:     Left = erlang:cancel_timer(R),
  127:     case Big - Left of
  128:         Diff when Diff >= 200, Diff < 10000 ->
  129:             ok;
  130:         _Diff ->
  131:             ct:fail({big, Big, Left})
  132:     end,
  133:     ok.
  134: 
  135: %% send_after/3: messages in the right order, kind version
  136: send_after_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  137:     _ = erlang:send_after(5000, self(), last),
  138:     _ = erlang:send_after(0, self(), a0),
  139:     _ = erlang:send_after(200, self(), a2),
  140:     _ = erlang:send_after(100, self(), a1),
  141:     _ = erlang:send_after(500, self(), a5),
  142:     _ = erlang:send_after(300, self(), a3),
  143:     _ = erlang:send_after(400, self(), a4),
  144:     [a0,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,last] = collect(last),
  145:     ok.
  146: 
  147: %% send_after/3: messages in the right order, worse than send_after_2
  148: send_after_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  149:     _ = erlang:send_after(100, self(), b1),
  150:     _ = erlang:send_after(101, self(), b2),
  151:     _ = erlang:send_after(102, self(), b3),
  152:     _ = erlang:send_after(103, self(), last),
  153:     [b1, b2, b3, last] = collect(last),
  154: 
  155:     % This behaviour is not guaranteed:
  156:     %    _ = erlang:send_after(100, self(), c1),
  157:     %    _ = erlang:send_after(100, self(), c2),
  158:     %    _ = erlang:send_after(100, self(), c3),
  159:     %    _ = erlang:send_after(100, self(), last),
  160:     %    [c1, c2, c3, last] = collect(last),
  161: 
  162:     ok.
  163: 
  164: %% Check trivial cancel_timer/1 behaviour
  165: cancel_timer_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  166:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(make_ref()),
  167: 
  168:     ok.
  169: 
  170: cancel_timer_sync(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  171:     cancel_timer_sync_test(true),
  172:     cancel_timer_sync_test(false).
  173: 
  174: cancel_timer_sync_test(SameSched) ->
  175:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
  176: 
  177:     R1 = erlang:send_after(1000, self(), cling),
  178:     R2 = erlang:send_after(1000, self(), clong),
  179:     R3 = erlang:send_after(1000, self(), clang),
  180:     TsSet = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  181:     R4 = erlang:send_after(0, self(), pling),
  182:     R5 = erlang:send_after(0, self(), plong),
  183:     R6 = erlang:send_after(0, self(), plang),
  184:     R7 = make_ref(),
  185:     R8 = make_ref(),
  186:     R9 = make_ref(),
  187: 
  188:     case SameSched of
  189: 	true ->
  190: 	    %% Cancel from the same scheduler...
  191: 	    ok;
  192: 	false->
  193: 	    %% Cancel from different scheduler...
  194: 	    process_flag(scheduler, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online))
  195:     end,
  196: 
  197:     C1 = erlang:cancel_timer(R1),
  198:     true = is_integer(C1),
  199:     C2 = erlang:cancel_timer(R2, [{info, true}]),
  200:     true = is_integer(C2),
  201:     ok = erlang:cancel_timer(R3, [{info, false}]),
  202: 
  203:     receive pling -> ok end,
  204:     receive plong -> ok end,
  205:     receive plang -> ok end,
  206: 
  207:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(R4),
  208:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(R5, [{info, true}]),
  209:     ok = erlang:cancel_timer(R6, [{info, false}]),
  210:     
  211:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(R7),
  212:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(R8, [{info, true}]),
  213:     ok = erlang:cancel_timer(R9, [{info, false}]),
  214:     
  215:     Wait = 1500 - erlang:convert_time_unit(erlang:monotonic_time() - TsSet,
  216: 					   native, millisecond),
  217: 
  218:     receive TMO when TMO == cling; TMO == clang; TMO == clong ->
  219: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_timeout, TMO})
  220:     after Wait ->
  221: 	    ok
  222:     end.
  223: 
  224: %% Error cases for start_timer/3
  225: start_timer_e(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  226:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:start_timer(-4, self(), hej)),
  227:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:start_timer(1 bsl 64,
  228:                                             self(), hej)),
  229: 
  230:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:start_timer(4.5, self(), hej)),
  231:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:start_timer(a, self(), hej)),
  232: 
  233:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  234:     Pid = spawn(Node, timer, sleep, [10000]),
  235:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:start_timer(1000, Pid, hej)),
  236:     peer:stop(Peer).
  237: 
  238: %% Error cases for send_after/3
  239: send_after_e(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  240:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:send_after(-4, self(), hej)),
  241:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:send_after(1 bsl 64,
  242:                                            self(), hej)),
  243: 
  244:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:send_after(4.5, self(), hej)),
  245:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:send_after(a, self(), hej)),
  246: 
  247:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  248:     Pid = spawn(Node, timer, sleep, [10000]),
  249:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:send_after(1000, Pid, hej)),
  250:     peer:stop(Peer).
  251: 
  252: %% Error cases for cancel_timer/1
  253: cancel_timer_e(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  254:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:cancel_timer(1)),
  255:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:cancel_timer(self())),
  256:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:cancel_timer(a)),
  257:     ok.
  258: 
  259: %% Trivial and error test cases for read_timer/1.
  260: read_timer_trivial(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  261:     false = erlang:read_timer(make_ref()),
  262:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:read_timer(42)),
  263:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:read_timer(423497834744444444457667444444)),
  264:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:read_timer(self())),
  265:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:read_timer(ab)),
  266:     ok.
  267: 
  268: %% Test that read_timer/1 seems to return the correct values.
  269: read_timer(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  270:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
  271:     Big = 1 bsl 31,
  272:     R = erlang:send_after(Big, self(), hej_hopp),
  273: 
  274:     receive after 200 -> ok end,		% Delay and clear reductions.
  275:     Left = erlang:read_timer(R),
  276:     Left2 = erlang:cancel_timer(R),
  277:     case Left == Left2 of
  278:         true -> ok;
  279:         false -> Left = Left2 + 1
  280:     end,
  281:     false = erlang:read_timer(R),
  282: 
  283:     case Big - Left of
  284:         Diff when Diff >= 200, Diff < 10000 ->
  285:             ok;
  286:         _Diff ->
  287:             ct:fail({big, Big, Left})
  288:     end,
  289:     process_flag(scheduler, 0),
  290:     ok.
  291: 
  292: %% Test that read_timer/1 seems to return the correct values.
  293: read_timer_async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  294:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
  295:     Big = 1 bsl 33,
  296:     R = erlang:send_after(Big, self(), hej_hopp),
  297: 
  298:     %% Access from another scheduler
  299:     process_flag(scheduler, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)),
  300: 
  301:     receive after 200 -> ok end,		% Delay and clear reductions.
  302:     ok = erlang:read_timer(R, [{async, true}]),
  303:     ok = erlang:cancel_timer(R, [{async, true}, {info, true}]),
  304:     ok = erlang:read_timer(R, [{async, true}]),
  305: 
  306:     {read_timer, R, Left} = receive_one(),
  307:     {cancel_timer, R, Left2} = receive_one(),
  308:     case Left == Left2 of
  309:         true -> ok;
  310:         false -> Left = Left2 + 1
  311:     end,
  312:     {read_timer, R, false} = receive_one(),
  313: 
  314:     case Big - Left of
  315:         Diff when Diff >= 200, Diff < 10000 ->
  316:             ok;
  317:         _Diff ->
  318:             ct:fail({big, Big, Left})
  319:     end,
  320:     process_flag(scheduler, 0),
  321:     ok.
  322: 
  323: cleanup(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  324:     Mem = mem(),
  325:     %% Timer on dead process
  326:     P1 = spawn(fun () -> ok end),
  327:     wait_until(fun () -> process_is_cleaned_up(P1) end),
  328:     T1 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT*2, P1, "hej"),
  329:     T2 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT*2, P1, "hej"),
  330:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  331:     Mem = mem(),
  332:     false = erlang:read_timer(T1),
  333:     false = erlang:read_timer(T2),
  334:     Mem = mem(),
  335:     %% Process dies before timeout
  336:     P2 = spawn(fun () -> receive after (?SHORT_TIMEOUT div 10) -> ok end end),
  337:     T3 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT*2, P2, "hej"),
  338:     T4 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT*2, P2, "hej"),
  339:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  340:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T3)),
  341:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T4)),
  342:     wait_until(fun () -> process_is_cleaned_up(P2) end),
  343:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  344:     false = erlang:read_timer(T3),
  345:     false = erlang:read_timer(T4),
  346:     Mem = mem(),
  347:     %% Cancel timer
  348:     P3 = spawn(fun () -> receive after ?SHORT_TIMEOUT*4 -> ok end end),
  349:     T5 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT*2, P3, "hej"),
  350:     T6 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT*2, P3, "hej"),
  351:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  352:     true = is_integer(erlang:cancel_timer(T5)),
  353:     true = is_integer(erlang:cancel_timer(T6)),
  354:     false = erlang:read_timer(T5),
  355:     false = erlang:read_timer(T6),
  356:     exit(P3, kill),
  357:     wait_until(fun () -> process_is_cleaned_up(P3) end),
  358:     Mem = mem(),
  359:     %% Timeout
  360:     Ref = make_ref(),
  361:     T7 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, self(), Ref),
  362:     T8 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, self(), Ref),
  363:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  364:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T7)),
  365:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T8)),
  366:     receive {timeout, T7, Ref} -> ok end,
  367:     receive Ref -> ok end,
  368:     Mem = mem(),
  369:     ok.
  370: 
  371: 
  372: evil_timers(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  373:     %% Create a composite term consisting of at least:
  374:     %% * externals (remote pids, ports, and refs)
  375:     %% * large (off heap) binaries
  376:     %% * small (heap) binaries
  377:     %% * funs
  378:     %% * bignums
  379:     %% * tuples
  380:     %% * lists
  381:     %% since data of these types have to be adjusted if moved
  382:     %% in memory
  383:     Self = self(),
  384:     R1 = make_ref(),
  385:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  386:     spawn_link(Node,
  387:                fun () ->
  388:                        Self ! {R1,
  389:                                [lists:sublist(erlang:ports(), 3),
  390:                                 [make_ref(), make_ref(), make_ref()],
  391:                                 lists:sublist(processes(), 3),
  392:                                 [fun () -> gurka end,
  393:                                  fun (A) -> A + 1 end,
  394:                                  fun (A, B) -> A + B end]]}
  395:                end),
  396:     ExtList = receive {R1, L} -> L end,
  397:     peer:stop(Peer),
  398:     BinList = [<<"bla">>,
  399:                <<"blipp">>,
  400:                <<"blupp">>,
  401:                list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000000,$a)),
  402:                list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000000,$b)),
  403:                list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000000,$c))],
  404:     FunList = [fun () -> gurka end,
  405:                fun (A) -> A + 1 end,
  406:                fun (A, B) -> A + B end],
  407:     PidList = lists:sublist(processes(), 3),
  408:     PortList = lists:sublist(erlang:ports(), 3),
  409:     RefList = [make_ref(), make_ref(), make_ref()],
  410:     BigList = [111111111111, 22222222222222, 333333333333333333],
  411:     Msg = {BinList,[FunList,{RefList,ExtList,PidList,PortList,BigList}]},
  412:     %% io:format("Msg=~p~n",[Msg]),
  413: 
  414:     Prio = process_flag(priority, max),
  415:     %%
  416:     %% In the smp case there are four major cases we want to test:
  417:     %%
  418:     %% 1. A timer started with erlang:start_timer(Time, Receiver, Msg),
  419:     %%    where Msg is a composite term, expires, and the receivers main
  420:     %%    lock *cannot* be acquired immediately (typically when the
  421:     %%    receiver *is* running).
  422:     %%
  423:     %%    The wrap tuple ({timeout, TRef, Msg}) will in this case
  424:     %%    be allocated in the previously allocated message buffer along
  425:     %%    with Msg, i.e. the previously allocated message buffer will be
  426:     %%    reallocated and potentially moved.
  427:     TimeOutMsgs0 = evil_setup_timers(200, Self, Msg),
  428:     RecvTimeOutMsgs0 = evil_recv_timeouts(200),
  429:     %% 2. A timer started with erlang:start_timer(Time, Receiver, Msg),
  430:     %%    where Msg is an immediate term, expires, and the receivers main
  431:     %%    lock *cannot* be acquired immediately (typically when the
  432:     %%    receiver *is* running).
  433:     %%
  434:     %%    The wrap tuple will in this case be allocated in a new
  435:     %%    message buffer.
  436:     TimeOutMsgs1 = evil_setup_timers(200, Self, immediate),
  437:     RecvTimeOutMsgs1 = evil_recv_timeouts(200),
  438:     %% 3. A timer started with erlang:start_timer(Time, Receiver, Msg),
  439:     %%    where Msg is a composite term, expires, and the receivers main
  440:     %%    lock *can* be acquired immediately (typically when the receiver
  441:     %%    *is not* running).
  442:     %%
  443:     %%    The wrap tuple will in this case be allocated on the receivers
  444:     %%    heap, and Msg is passed in the previously allocated message
  445:     %%    buffer.
  446:     R2 = make_ref(),
  447:     spawn_link(fun () ->
  448:                        Self ! {R2, evil_setup_timers(200, Self, Msg)}
  449:                end),
  450:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  451:     TimeOutMsgs2 = receive {R2, TOM2} -> TOM2 end,
  452:     RecvTimeOutMsgs2 = evil_recv_timeouts(200),
  453:     %% 4. A timer started with erlang:start_timer(Time, Receiver, Msg),
  454:     %%    where Msg is an immediate term, expires, and the Receivers main
  455:     %%    lock *can* be acquired immediately (typically when the receiver
  456:     %%    *is not* running).
  457:     %%
  458:     %%    The wrap tuple will in this case be allocated on the receivers
  459:     %%    heap.
  460:     R3 = make_ref(),
  461:     spawn_link(fun () ->
  462:                        Self ! {R3, evil_setup_timers(200,Self,immediate)}
  463:                end),
  464:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  465:     TimeOutMsgs3 = receive {R3, TOM3} -> TOM3 end,
  466:     RecvTimeOutMsgs3 = evil_recv_timeouts(200),
  467: 
  468:     %% Garge collection will hopefully crash the emulator if something
  469:     %% is wrong...
  470:     garbage_collect(),
  471:     garbage_collect(),
  472:     garbage_collect(),
  473: 
  474:     %% Make sure we got the timeouts we expected
  475:     %%
  476:     %% Note timeouts are *not* guaranteed to be delivered in order
  477:     ok = match(lists:sort(RecvTimeOutMsgs0), lists:sort(TimeOutMsgs0)),
  478:     ok = match(lists:sort(RecvTimeOutMsgs1), lists:sort(TimeOutMsgs1)),
  479:     ok = match(lists:sort(RecvTimeOutMsgs2), lists:sort(TimeOutMsgs2)),
  480:     ok = match(lists:sort(RecvTimeOutMsgs3), lists:sort(TimeOutMsgs3)),
  481: 
  482:     process_flag(priority, Prio),
  483:     ok.
  484: 
  485: evil_setup_timers(N, Receiver, Msg) ->
  486:     evil_setup_timers(0, N, Receiver, Msg, []).
  487: 
  488: evil_setup_timers(N, N, _Receiver, _Msg, TOs) ->
  489:     TOs;
  490: evil_setup_timers(N, Max, Receiver, Msg, TOs) ->
  491:     TRef = erlang:start_timer(N, Receiver, Msg),
  492:     evil_setup_timers(N+1, Max, Receiver, Msg, [{timeout,TRef,Msg}|TOs]).
  493: 
  494: 
  495: evil_recv_timeouts(M) ->
  496:     evil_recv_timeouts([], 0, M).
  497: 
  498: evil_recv_timeouts(TOs, N, N) ->
  499:     TOs;
  500: evil_recv_timeouts(TOs, N, M) ->
  501:     receive
  502:         {timeout, _, _} = TO ->
  503:             evil_recv_timeouts([TO|TOs], N+1, M)
  504:     after 0 ->
  505:               evil_recv_timeouts(TOs, N, M)
  506:     end.
  507: 
  508: registered_process(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  509:     Mem = mem(),
  510:     %% Cancel
  511:     T1 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, ?MODULE, "hej"),
  512:     T2 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, ?MODULE, "hej"),
  513:     undefined = whereis(?MODULE),
  514:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  515:     true = is_integer(erlang:cancel_timer(T1)),
  516:     true = is_integer(erlang:cancel_timer(T2)),
  517:     false = erlang:read_timer(T1),
  518:     false = erlang:read_timer(T2),
  519:     Mem = mem(),
  520:     %% Timeout register after start
  521:     Ref1 = make_ref(),
  522:     T3 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, ?MODULE, Ref1),
  523:     T4 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, ?MODULE, Ref1),
  524:     undefined = whereis(?MODULE),
  525:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  526:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T3)),
  527:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T4)),
  528:     true = register(?MODULE, self()),
  529:     receive {timeout, T3, Ref1} -> ok end,
  530:     receive Ref1 -> ok end,
  531:     Mem = mem(),
  532:     %% Timeout register before start
  533:     Ref2 = make_ref(),
  534:     T5 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, ?MODULE, Ref2),
  535:     T6 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, ?MODULE, Ref2),
  536:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  537:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T5)),
  538:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T6)),
  539:     receive {timeout, T5, Ref2} -> ok end,
  540:     receive Ref2 -> ok end,
  541:     Mem = mem(),
  542:     true = unregister(?MODULE),
  543:     ok.
  544: 
  545: same_time_yielding(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  546:     Mem = mem(),
  547:     Ref = make_ref(),
  548:     SchdlrsOnline = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  549:     SchdlrsToUse = erlang:max(1, erlang:min(8, SchdlrsOnline) - 1),
  550:     StartTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  551:     Tmo = StartTime + 20000,
  552:     NrOfTimeouts = (?TIMEOUT_YIELD_LIMIT*3+1) * SchdlrsToUse,
  553:     NrOfTimeoutsPerScheduler = NrOfTimeouts div SchdlrsToUse,
  554:     Tmrs = lists:map(fun (I) ->
  555:                              SchedulerId =
  556:                                  case SchdlrsOnline of
  557:                                      1 -> 1;
  558:                                      _ ->
  559:                                          ((I div NrOfTimeoutsPerScheduler) rem SchdlrsToUse)  + 2
  560:                                  end,
  561:                              process_flag(scheduler, SchedulerId),
  562:                              erlang:start_timer(Tmo, self(), Ref, [{abs, true}]),
  563:                              SchedulerId
  564:                      end,
  565:                      lists:seq(1, NrOfTimeouts)),
  566:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
  567:     AllTimersStartedTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  568:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  569:     {TimeToReceive, TimeUntilFirst} = receive_all_timeouts(length(Tmrs), Ref),
  570:     Done = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  571:     true = Done >= Tmo,
  572:     MsAfterTmo = Done - Tmo,
  573:     io:format("Done ~p ms after Tmo\nInfo: ~p\n",
  574:               [MsAfterTmo,
  575:                {'TimeToStartAllTimers', AllTimersStartedTime - StartTime,
  576:                 'TimeInReceiveUntilFirst',TimeUntilFirst,
  577:                 'TimeToReceive', TimeToReceive}]),
  578:     case erlang:system_info(build_type) of
  579:         opt ->
  580:             true = MsAfterTmo < 200;
  581:         _ ->
  582:             true = MsAfterTmo < 1000
  583:     end,
  584:     Mem = mem(),
  585:     ok.
  586: 
  587: %% Read out all timeouts in receive queue order. This is efficient
  588: %% even if there are very many messages.
  589: 
  590: receive_all_timeouts(N, Ref) ->
  591:     receive_all_timeouts(N, Ref, not_set).
  592: 
  593: receive_all_timeouts(0, _Ref, {FirstTime, TimeUntilFirst}) ->
  594:     {erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) - FirstTime, TimeUntilFirst};
  595: receive_all_timeouts(N, Ref, Timings) ->
  596:     StartTime = case Timings of
  597:         not_set -> erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond);
  598:         _ -> ok
  599:     end,
  600:     receive
  601:         {timeout, _Tmr, Ref} ->
  602:             NewTimings =
  603:                 case Timings of
  604:                     not_set ->
  605:                         FirstMessageAtTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  606:                         {FirstMessageAtTime, FirstMessageAtTime - StartTime};
  607:                     _ -> Timings
  608:                 end,
  609:             receive_all_timeouts(N-1, Ref, NewTimings)
  610:     end.
  611: 
  612: same_time_yielding_with_cancel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  613:     same_time_yielding_with_cancel_test(false, false).
  614: 
  615: same_time_yielding_with_cancel_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  616:     same_time_yielding_with_cancel_test(true, false).
  617: 
  618: %same_time_yielding_with_cancel_other_accessor(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  619: %    same_time_yielding_with_cancel_test(true, true).
  620: 
  621: do_cancel_tmrs(Tmo, Tmrs, Tester) ->
  622:     BeginCancel = erlang:convert_time_unit(Tmo,
  623:                                            millisecond,
  624:                                            microsecond) - 500,
  625:     busy_wait_until(fun () ->
  626:                             erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond) >= BeginCancel
  627:                     end),
  628:     lists:foreach(fun (Tmr) ->
  629:                           erlang:cancel_timer(Tmr,
  630:                                               [{async, true},
  631:                                                {info, true}])
  632:                   end, Tmrs),
  633:     case Tester == self() of
  634:         true -> ok;
  635:         false -> forward_msgs(Tester)
  636:     end.
  637: 
  638: same_time_yielding_with_cancel_test(Other, Accessor) ->
  639:     Mem = mem(),
  640:     SchdlrsOnline = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  641:     SchdlrsToUse = erlang:max(1, erlang:min(8, SchdlrsOnline) - 1),
  642:     NrOfTimeouts = (?TIMEOUT_YIELD_LIMIT*3+1) * SchdlrsToUse,
  643:     NrOfTimeoutsPerScheduler = NrOfTimeouts div SchdlrsToUse,
  644:     Tmo = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) + 6000,
  645:     Tester = self(),
  646:     Cancelor = case Other of
  647:                    false ->
  648:                        Tester;
  649:                    true ->
  650:                        spawn(fun () ->
  651:                                      receive
  652:                                          {timers, Tmrs} ->
  653:                                              do_cancel_tmrs(Tmo, Tmrs, Tester)
  654:                                      end
  655:                              end)
  656:                end,
  657:     Opts = case Accessor of
  658:                false -> [{abs, true}];
  659:                true -> [{accessor, Cancelor}, {abs, true}]
  660:            end,
  661:     Tmrs = lists:map(fun (I) ->
  662:                              SchedulerId =
  663:                                  case SchdlrsOnline of
  664:                                      1 -> 1;
  665:                                      _ ->
  666:                                          ((I div NrOfTimeoutsPerScheduler) rem SchdlrsToUse)  + 2
  667:                                  end,
  668:                              process_flag(scheduler, SchedulerId),
  669:                              erlang:start_timer(Tmo, self(), hej, Opts)
  670:                      end,
  671:                      lists:seq(1, NrOfTimeouts)),
  672:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
  673:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  674:     case Other of
  675:         false ->
  676:             do_cancel_tmrs(Tmo, Tmrs, Tester);
  677:         true ->
  678:             Cancelor ! {timers, Tmrs}
  679:     end,
  680:     {Tmos, Cncls} = lists:foldl(fun (Tmr, {T, C}) ->
  681:                                         receive
  682:                                             {timeout, Tmr, hej} ->
  683:                                                 receive
  684:                                                     {cancel_timer, Tmr, Info} ->
  685:                                                         false = Info,
  686:                                                         {T+1, C}
  687:                                                 end;
  688:                                             {cancel_timer, Tmr, false} ->
  689:                                                 receive
  690:                                                     {timeout, Tmr, hej} ->
  691:                                                         {T+1, C}
  692:                                                 end;
  693:                                             {cancel_timer, Tmr, TimeLeft} ->
  694:                                                 true = is_integer(TimeLeft),
  695:                                                 {T, C+1}
  696:                                         end
  697:                                 end,
  698:                                 {0, 0},
  699:                                 Tmrs),
  700:     io:format("Timeouts: ~p Cancels: ~p~n", [Tmos, Cncls]),
  701:     Mem = mem(),
  702:     case Other of
  703:         true -> exit(Cancelor, bang);
  704:         false -> ok
  705:     end,
  706:     {comment,
  707:      "Timeouts: " ++ integer_to_list(Tmos) ++ " Cancels: "
  708:      ++ integer_to_list(Cncls)}.
  709: 
  710: auto_cancel_yielding(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  711:     Mem = mem(),
  712:     SchdlrsOnln = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  713:     P = spawn(fun () ->
  714:                       lists:foreach(
  715:                         fun (I) ->
  716:                                 process_flag(scheduler, (I rem SchdlrsOnln)+1),
  717:                                 erlang:start_timer((1 bsl 28)+I*10, self(), hej)
  718:                         end,
  719:                         lists:seq(1,
  720:                                   ((?AUTO_CANCEL_YIELD_LIMIT*3+1)
  721:                                    *SchdlrsOnln))),
  722:                       receive after infinity -> ok end
  723:               end),
  724:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  725:     exit(P, bang),
  726:     wait_until(fun () -> process_is_cleaned_up(P) end),
  727:     Mem = mem(),
  728:     ok.
  729: 
  730: suspended_scheduler_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  731:     Ref = make_ref(),
  732:     SchdlrsOnln = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  733:     lists:foreach(fun (Sched) ->
  734:                           process_flag(scheduler, Sched),
  735:                           erlang:send_after(1000, self(), {Ref, Sched})
  736:                   end,
  737:                   lists:seq(1, SchdlrsOnln)),
  738:     process_flag(scheduler, 0),
  739:     erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, 1),
  740:     try
  741:         lists:foreach(fun (Sched) ->
  742:                               receive
  743:                                   {Ref, Sched} ->
  744:                                       ok
  745:                               after 2000 ->
  746:                                       ct:fail({missing_timeout, Sched})
  747:                               end
  748:                       end,
  749:                       lists:seq(1, SchdlrsOnln))
  750:     after
  751:         erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SchdlrsOnln)
  752:     end,
  753:     ok.
  754: 
  755: multizero_timeout_in_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  756:     Timeout = 500,
  757:     MaxTimeoutDiff = 1000,
  758: 
  759:     %% We want to operate on the same timer wheel all the time...
  760:     process_flag(scheduler, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)),
  761: 
  762:     erlang:send_after(5*(Timeout+MaxTimeoutDiff), self(), pling),
  763:     erlang:yield(),
  764:     Start = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  765:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(multizero_timeout_in_timeout, Timeout),
  766:     receive multizero_timeout_in_timeout_done -> ok end,
  767:     End = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  768:     Time = erlang:convert_time_unit(End-Start, native, millisecond),
  769:     io:format("Time=~p~n", [Time]),
  770:     true = Time < Timeout + MaxTimeoutDiff,
  771:     ok.
  772: 
  773: huge_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  774:     %% More than 2^31 seconds...
  775:     huge_timeout_test((1 bsl 31)*1000 + 1000),
  776:     %% More than 2^32 seconds...
  777:     huge_timeout_test((1 bsl 32)*1000 + 1000),
  778:     %% More than 2^31 milliseconds...
  779:     huge_timeout_test((1 bsl 31) + 1000),
  780:     %% More than 2^32 milliseconds...
  781:     huge_timeout_test((1 bsl 32) + 1000),
  782:     ok.
  783: 
  784: huge_timeout_test(HugeTmo) ->
  785:     SOnln = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  786:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  787:     %% Likely to hit the bug if we set a huge timeout in an
  788:     %% empty timer wheel, then set a small timeout
  789:     %% and let the small timeout trigger. The huge timeout
  790:     %% will then be found as the next timeout in the wheel.
  791:     %% Just setting a huge timeout wont trigger the bug
  792:     %% since an empty wheel have a fake timeout of one week.
  793:     Ps = lists:map(
  794:            fun (N) ->
  795:                    spawn_opt(
  796:                      fun () ->
  797:                              erlang:send_after(HugeTmo, self(), hej),
  798:                              erlang:send_after(2, self(), hej),
  799:                              receive after infinity -> ok end
  800:                      end, [{scheduler,N}, link])
  801:            end, lists:seq(1, erlang:system_info(schedulers))),
  802:     %% If we have schedulers offline, those timer wheels are likely
  803:     %% empty, so set them online increasing the chanse of hitting
  804:     %% a bug.
  805:     try
  806:         erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, erlang:system_info(schedulers)),
  807:         receive after 1000 -> ok end
  808:     after
  809:         lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
  810:                               unlink(P),
  811:                               exit(P, kill),
  812:                               false = is_process_alive(P)
  813:                       end, Ps),
  814:         erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SOnln),
  815:         process_flag(trap_exit, false)
  816:     end.
  817: 
  818: process_is_cleaned_up(P) when is_pid(P) ->
  819:     undefined == erts_debug:get_internal_state({process_status, P}).
  820: 
  821: wait_until(Pred) when is_function(Pred) ->
  822:     case catch Pred() of
  823:         true -> ok;
  824:         _ -> receive after 50 -> ok end, wait_until(Pred)
  825:     end.
  826: 
  827: busy_wait_until(Pred) when is_function(Pred) ->
  828:     case catch Pred() of
  829:         true -> ok;
  830:         _ -> busy_wait_until(Pred)
  831:     end.
  832: 
  833: forward_msgs(To) ->
  834:     receive
  835:         Msg ->
  836:             To ! Msg
  837:     end,
  838:     forward_msgs(To).
  839: 
  840: get(Time, Msg) ->
  841:     receive 
  842:         Msg ->
  843:             ok
  844:     after Time
  845:           ->
  846:               no_message
  847:     end.
  848: 
  849: get_msg() ->
  850:     receive
  851:         Msg ->
  852:             {ok, Msg}
  853:     after 0 ->
  854:               empty
  855:     end.
  856: 
  857: collect(Last) ->
  858:     collect(Last, []).
  859: 
  860: receive_one() ->
  861:     receive
  862:         Msg ->
  863:             Msg
  864:     end.
  865: 
  866: collect(Last, Msgs0) ->
  867:     Msg = receive_one(),
  868:     Msgs = Msgs0 ++ [Msg],
  869:     case Msg of
  870:         Last ->
  871:             Msgs;
  872:         _ ->
  873:             collect(Last, Msgs)
  874:     end.
  875: 
  876: match(X, X) ->
  877:     %erlang:display({match, X}),
  878:     ok;
  879: match(X, Y) ->
  880:     %erlang:display({mismatch, X, Y}),
  881:     match_aux(X, Y).
  882: 
  883: match_aux(X, X) ->
  884:     unexpected_error;
  885: match_aux(X, Y) when is_list(X), is_list(Y), length(X) =/= length(Y) ->
  886:     %% erlang:display({mismatch, X, Y}),
  887:     {list_length_mismatch, length(X), length(Y)};
  888: match_aux([X|Xs], [X|Ys]) ->
  889:     match_aux(Xs, Ys);
  890: match_aux([X|_], [Y|_]) ->
  891:     match_aux(X, Y);
  892: match_aux(X, Y) when is_tuple(X), is_tuple(Y), size(X) =/= size(Y) ->
  893:     %% erlang:display({mismatch, X, Y}),
  894:     {tuple_size_mismatch, size(X), size(Y)};
  895: match_aux(X, Y) when is_tuple(X), is_tuple(Y) ->
  896:     match_aux(tuple_to_list(X), tuple_to_list(Y));
  897: match_aux(X, Y) ->
  898:     %% erlang:display({mismatch, X, Y}),
  899:     {mismatch, type(X), type(Y)}.
  900: 
  901: type(X) when is_list(X) -> list;
  902: type(X) when is_tuple(X) -> tuple;
  903: type(X) when is_float(X) -> float;
  904: type(X) when is_integer(X) -> integer;
  905: type(X) when is_pid(X) -> {pid, node(X)};
  906: type(X) when is_reference(X) -> {reference, node(X)};
  907: type(X) when is_port(X) -> {port, node(X)};
  908: type(X) when is_binary(X) -> binary;
  909: type(X) when is_atom(X) -> atom;
  910: type(_) -> unknown.
  911: 
  912: 
  913: mem_larger_than(no_fix_alloc) ->
  914:     true;
  915: mem_larger_than(Mem) ->
  916:     mem() > Mem.
  917: 
  918: mem() ->
  919:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, timer_cancellations),
  920:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, deallocations),
  921:     case mem_get() of
  922:         {-1, -1} -> no_fix_alloc;
  923:         {A, U} -> io:format("mem = ~p ~p~n", [A, U]), U
  924:     end.
  925: 
  926: mem_get() ->
  927:     % Bif timer memory
  928:     Ref = make_ref(),
  929:     erlang:system_info({memory_internal, Ref, [fix_alloc]}),
  930:     mem_recv(erts_internal:no_aux_work_threads()-1, Ref, {0, 0}).
  931: 
  932: mem_recv(0, _Ref, AU) ->
  933:     AU;
  934: mem_recv(N, Ref, AU) ->
  935:     receive
  936:         {Ref, _, IL} ->
  937:             mem_recv(N-1, Ref, mem_parse_ilists(IL, AU))
  938:     end.
  939: 
  940: 
  941: mem_parse_ilists([], AU) ->
  942:     AU;
  943: mem_parse_ilists([I|Is], AU) ->
  944:     mem_parse_ilists(Is, mem_parse_ilist(I, AU)).
  945: 
  946: mem_parse_ilist({fix_alloc, false}, _) ->
  947:     {-1, -1};
  948: mem_parse_ilist({fix_alloc, _, IDL}, {A, U}) ->
  949:     case lists:keyfind(fix_types, 1, IDL) of
  950:         {fix_types, TL} ->
  951:             {ThisA, ThisU} = mem_get_btm_aus(TL, 0, 0),
  952:             {ThisA + A, ThisU + U};
  953:         {fix_types, Mask, TL} ->
  954:             {ThisA, ThisU} = mem_get_btm_aus(TL, 0, 0),
  955:             {(ThisA + A) band Mask , (ThisU + U) band Mask}
  956:     end.
  957: 
  958: mem_get_btm_aus([], A, U) ->
  959:     {A, U};
  960: mem_get_btm_aus([{BtmType, BtmA, BtmU} | Types],
  961:                 A, U) when BtmType == bif_timer;
  962:                            BtmType == accessor_bif_timer ->
  963:     mem_get_btm_aus(Types, BtmA+A, BtmU+U);
  964: mem_get_btm_aus([_|Types], A, U) ->
  965:     mem_get_btm_aus(Types, A, U).
